comment: All of the quizzes and exams were open note. There are three papers for this class, 2 of them about specific books and the last one is a health intervention paper. You have weekly discussion posts and have to reply to 2 people. Very easy class, just put in the effort.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Love Dr. Treiber! She's awesome and caring. Be prepared to read and write. Put in effort and earn an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Outside of all the long readings, I loved this class. Professor Linda takes pride in her course and is firm on due dates but the course itself so easy to follow! I only made a B because I missed a paper and got a zero. I made 100-96 on everything else, the work is 15 discussions, 3 exams, a 8- 10 page final paper and two reaction papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: I thought Prof Treiber was great. She is personable, enthusiastic, and has a sense of humor. There are 3 papers throughout the course, but they are doable, and the books are actually interesting to read.

She's so so so sweet. She made class so fun and interesting so I actually looked forward to it. She's so funny and makes an amazing professor. She isn't much of a harsh grader but her test are multiple choice with an essay which isn't my favorite, but she makes it very doable and non stressful.

I enjoyed this class, but be prepared to read a lot. There are a few required books that you will write short papers on. The books are pretty interesting. There are also some articles you will need to read. Attendance is required, but this class is helpful today - you'll enjoy it. I would have gotten an A if I read a little more.

Dr. Treiber is a GREAT professor. She is very helpful with any issues you may be having. The assignments are pretty straight forward as long as you view her notes and videos. I have taken about 4 of her classes now, all easy.
Great professor ! Be prepared to write 4 essays and take 3 tests. Professor Treiber will prepare you for them. She is lively, funny, and cool. Recommend 10/10

She is a pretty good professor, and a lot of the things seem very straightforward; however, once you get to the exams, she will choose the smallest details. For exams, you have 25 multiple choice questions and have to answer a question. For the essay, you have to write about a page and a half or more to get full credit.

Absolutely wonderful professor. The book selection used for course material was fantastic. Lectures are great and she keeps the tests concise and focused on the course material with no extra fluff added. She is the best teacher I have had so far in college and this has been one of the only classes I have truly enjoyed. 10/10 would recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: For an 1101 sociology class, Dr. Treiber's class is fairly easy, as long as you put in the work. Given it was a summer class with less time than normal, there were about 3 Chapters/week, with a quiz and discussion board (and response) for each chapter, a short (3 Pg.) term paper, and three exams. Easy A if you do the work and put in the effort.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Love Dr. Treiber! Even through an online class it is very evident how much she cares about her students and wants them to succeed. She gives great feedback on big assignments. There is a lot of chapter reading that is necessary for taking quizzes and the test, not hard at all just a little time consuming. Already signed up to take her again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Best professor hands down. There are a few books to read but they are pagers. Keep up with weekly reading and complete all your assignments, you will get an A!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Gives good feedback

comment: weekly quiz and DB, exams, one 8-10 page paper and some smaller ones, no text book, instead we read several small books, they were really good.

I enjoyed this class so much. Dr. Treiber is wonderful. The topic is interesting. There are 3 tests, study the power points and you'll do fine. You will have to write an 8-10 page paper about an Organization (One you might have worked at) and you will present your topic as well. Choose an org. that you know a lot about and it will be easy!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: I've taken her every semester for the past 5 semesters. She's great and really helpful. You can tell she's passionate about what she teaches. Take her! You won't regret it.

Great professor! I always choose her when I have more than one option for a specific class. She teaches in a way that is easy to understand course material. She uses great examples to connect course material to real life if the class looks puzzled.  Always be sure to study for her exams.

Treiber is my favorite teacher at KSU in the 3 years I have been here. I have taken her for 4 upper level sociology courses now because she is the best! She keeps things interesting and grades easily and fairly. She's great to talk to outside of class also.. I would take her for the rest of my 4000 level classes if she taught them.

Dr. Treiber is one of the best professors I have ever had. Took SOCI 3344 as my first 2 week Maymester. She is clear, understanding, easy going, funny, and intelligent. Not only was this a do-able A, I learned a lot too. Consisted of 4 papers (based on a 12 chap book), attendance/participation, a debate, and a final. BY FAR my favorite! TAKE HER

By far my favorite professor at KSU. She goes above and beyond in her teaching and keeps this class very interesting. She is extremely fair when it comes to grading and cares a lot about what you take away from the class. She clearly wants to make a difference and continually does so. I'm taking her for every possible class I can.

Grade consists of 3 book review papers, 1 movie review paper, 2 tests, a group project, and participation. Treiber is very knowledgeable about the topics in the class and encourages class participation. The books she assigned were interesting. She uses powerpoints that she posts on line, which are really helpful for tests! I would recommend her!
Very knowledgeable and had real life experience.  Fair with subject, funny at times, kept it interesting.

Medical Sociology was one of the hardest classes I have taken In college. If you take her, make sure to study the book chapters word by word. She will require students to participate in one long (entire period) discussion with a group. she also requires a 6-8 pg essay which she grades it fair. Her exams are challenging, but not hard.

Professor Treiber is,by far, my favorite professor in Kennesaw State. I would recommend this professor to everyone who is willing to work, study, and study hard. Make sure to purchase the three textbooks she requires for her courses, and take good notes to study for her exams. TREIBER FOR PRESIDENT 2016!!!

You must take this teacher. She is awesome. beware that there is not to many chances o make grades so do good on the assignments and tests. She made class fun and she is very easy going. Ifnormation on her test were straight off her powerpoints. there is a cumalitive test which was very easy. Participation is huge with her show up and get A.

She's awesome. Kind of quirky, but really enjoys the material. Straightforward and doesn't grade hard. Tests are easy as long as you attended lecture and paid attention. Likes if you participate. Interesting class in general, but as she was a nurse she has an inside perspective. Take her.

I absolutely love Dr. Treiber! She is a wonderful teacher and loves what she teaches. I have a taken her twice and have loved her for both classes. Her test are multiple choice & essay. Her assignments are mostly summaries & in Med Soci there is a term paper due at the end. Her directions are pretty clear & she does take role.

Treiber is great at teaching because she is so passionate about the subject. I rated her easiness so high because she is very clear on the requirements of the student and will help you with anything at all. Read the chapters and pay attention in class and you'll do well.

I took her for SOCI 2251 & SOCI 3344. She is really great. Makes class interesting. You'll get an A or B if you do the work. Attendance is part of your grade. For 2251, we had 9 one-page papers & 3 exams. For 3344, it was a Maymester: 4 papers & 1 exam. I got an A in both classes. Take her if you can!

Treiber is genuinely interesting and interested. She asks a lot of questions and interacts well with students. The text is very Marxist but quite insightful. She looks like Maggie Gyllenhaal or maybe that therapist from The Departed. She has an attendance sheet. 9 one page papers on news articles. Good class.
Extremely knowledgeable. Listens to whatever you have to say with an open mind. Lectures are detailed and interesting. Grades papers with fairness.
She is a good teacher, but tough in grading papers. Doesn't give study guides for tests or communicate through GAView

This teacher is great! O had no knowledge about Sociology befpre taking this class and love it.  She really enjoys what she teaches and It is easy to learn.  I recomend this teacher to anyone wanting an easy A

she's very enthusiastic. we had discussion groups, like 5 two-page journals and a monster 10 page paper. Tests are ok. She asks some random things that you couldn't study for. She makes class enjoyable. I would take her again for sure.

Took her sex roles course too. Very open-minded, liberal & knowledgeable. Graded tests & papers fairly in my opinion. She facilitated class discussions well & kept her test formats the same so it was easy to study for them. Enjoyed her feminism while remaining accepting of the views of others. Great professor & answers questions well too.

Dr. Treiber is so awesome; she is smart, funny, and organized. There are no tricks in this class. you will learn a tremendous amount in any class of hers. She facilitates class so well; it's unbelievable. I would recommend her to all.

This instructor is far from being laid back and easy. Is not organized nor prepared for her classes. Takes easy way in giving test by using  test banks that are provided by the publisher of the books used. Lectures are not even close to subject unless its on sex, then is is very neomarxists. Very judgmental of others opposite of her. Needs help.

Great class. The tests were very easy and straightforward if you read the textbook. My only complaint is that the term paper on McDonaldization was pretty confusing. She's very nice, but can be intimidating at times. Class discussions were interesting. Easy A.

She's ok, very nice lady, enthusiastic about class.  There were weekly 1 pg. summaries on articles we read which we discussed in group setting, A research term paper, she grades hard on that, and her tests were ok. Make sure you study all notes and read every chapter. She will put info from books in tests. And Buy all 3 books. You will need them.

Great Professor. I had her for Medical Sociology and it was a great class. We had weekly reviews and class discussions. She s fairly open minded and laid back. She is majorly feminist so becareful how you say things.

Treiber's my fave professor at KSU. Took her for Med Soci and I looked forward to going to class. She's not hard to please; there's a wkly ch summary due & students are responsible for leading a ch discussion. Tests aren't bad. There's a paper, but she seemed flexible. LOVED her roundtable discussion format! Show up, show interest & do well!

Took her for Medical Sociology and it is a tough class. Material is very in depth and intense at times. Exams are quite difficult and the best way to be prepared is not to ask what to study for, just review everything that may be included. If you don`t do this, do not expect a good grade. If you want an A in the course, plan to work your butt off !
Very bad. Asked her for help but she offered none when I emailed her. Would definately recommend taking an easier professor, where you will learn alot more.
When she tells you to study for a test she is not to clear on what she wants. She doesn't write  her own tests, she gets the questions from a website.

I agree that class is boring, and a little hard.  She knows a little bit about a lot, and is very smart, but she doesn't go indepth into anything.  She's the advisor for the honor students, and a good one.

I have had Dr. Treiber for several classes, and  I felt dissipointed both times because I didn't learn anything that wasn't in the book.  I think Medical Soci is her best area, other than that, I would not take her again.

She is a Neo-feminist and SHE DOES push her beliefs on the class.  Very boring and does not seem to have control of the class at times.  On top of that, she is not a good teacher.  Anyone who does not share her beliefs is a bigot. Don't take her unless you have liberal views as well or don't get offended easily.

How can anyone say she is laid back! OMG!  Her tests were hard.  After everyone did so bad on the first one she started doing a five min test review b4 tests, which helped a lot.  Very picky on her papers.

Great! She is so laid back and easy when it comes to grading! All you have to do is come to class, and show her your trying and you'll pass! She is so real with her views and dosen't try to hide or cover her views on subject matters. I loved taking this class and if you want to learn anything about race in the USA you'll love taking this class too!

Treiber is very intelligent, enthusiastic, fair, and helpful. Her classes are quite easy, as she requires little and grades lightly. You really have to try to get less than a "B." She's a bit Marxist (but so is the discipline of sociology) and does not proselytize..."anti-marriage?" She's engaged, dimwit, and has never stated opposition to marriage

Hard test, hard paper, and didn't learn much.  I don't think this is her area.  She may be better in other classes.  Her tests were hard and she is a tough grader.Her requirements for her paper were just crazy.  Take Fine, Allen, or Boeri if you can.

Very good teacher. On the feminist side but does not push other than admitting to her beliefs. The class is better when there is verbal participation. Tests are easy, straight from the book (w/the exception of essays), but studies should be kept up with. It bit some students on the ass because book was barely cracked open.

She's so scattered.No organization to notes or lecture.I found her tests to be rather easy(I studied),but others got B's and C's on tests w/o studying.She's anti marriage,and quite the feminist,but she doesn't try to force her opinion on students.She takes attendance sometimes,but there isn't a huge penalty for missing class.Don'tWasteYourTuition$
